reviews.title: It's Okay
reviews.text: The benefits are really great, but the management in my area is not the strongest management team I've had. There seems to be no consequences for poor actions.

reviews.title: Has all the bells and whistles free to employees, Gym, Pub, Free Food
reviews.text: I would never work for TripAdvisor again.  They provide lot's of perks, but they change their mission/business model daily.  However, you are a recent college graduate, it's a great place to learn to sell in a fun, open environment.  Note:  They will let you go within a week or two if you don't fit in.  I've never seen anything like it.
reviews.cons: All over the place, leadership can't make up their mind, and all changes are made last minute with little to no communication.
reviews.pros: Free Lunch, Gym, Pub, Snacks 24/7, Games, bring your dog to work

reviews.title: TripAdvisor is an amazing place to work. I would highly recommend working there.
reviews.text: I am grateful for my time at TripAdvisor as a Content Marketing Intern where I worked on a diverse, yet dynamic team that helped each other grow and learn on a daily basis.
reviews.pros: Free lunches, dogs, corporate sponsored events, fitness activities, massages & more

reviews.title: Great workplace
reviews.text: Great workplace to work with amazing teams and managements.  Work hard, play hard and Speed wins in the business models. Always focus on travelers in the world.

reviews.title: Great company
reviews.text: The work environment is high energy. Expectations are high but so are the rewards. This job is for someone that is disciplined and enjoys being challenged. The culture is work hard, play hard. The best part of the job are the people and the benefits!

reviews.title: Overall a great place to intern
reviews.text: I did my internship at TripAdvisor in product management and it was a great place to see how big tech does product. Overall, in comparison to other places i have worked, TripAdvisor excels at communication across teams, providing autonomy to individuals to contribute, and values good work/life balance. TripAdvisor was probably the most laid back place I have ever worked, but we still got our projects done with incredible attention to detail.
reviews.pros: Great Management, good work life balance, shuttle to office from Boston, catered lunch, gym, great office

reviews.title: Interesante
reviews.text: Solo como colaborador externo. Me parece un tema interesante. Además siempre  hay apoyo  e incentivos para seguir adelante y colaborar mas

reviews.title: Great place to work
reviews.text: Innovative, passionate, fearless, creative, driven, and adaptable. Our core values are at the heart of who we are. We have a spontaneous and vibrant culture, and we truly believe in team spirit and collaboration.

reviews.title: Great, smart people to work with
reviews.text:
- Everyday can be different
- Collaboration is there if you want it
- Motto is speed wins but reality is projects take a very long time to finish 
- Engineering runs the show
reviews.cons: they promote people to manage teams that have no experience managing

reviews.title: Great company with management that cares
reviews.text: I loved working at TripAdvisor. The opportunities are there for the taking if you show up, work hard, and show interest in growth. My managers were constantly there to make sure my questions were answered and to ask me where I wanted to go with my career.  The only con were that the position was paid lower than others in the area (I think they tried to compensate this with benefits but I would have preferred 5k more in my paycheck over company events to be honest).
reviews.cons: Sometimes too laid back, salary was too low for the role
reviews.pros: great benefits, collaborative work environment, room for growth

reviews.title: Great Place to Work
reviews.text: TripAdvisor’s Internship Program was extraordinary. The recruiting staff did such a great job with getting the 200 interns familiar with their new work environment. There were events such as: scavenger hunts in Boston, ice breakers, bubble soccer, and mystery games. I was placed with the brand design team on the 6th floor. My manager made my experience there so comfortable and helped me to challenge myself each day without feeling overwhelmed. The other members of the team were delightful to work with as well. They would always help me if I had any questions and steer me in the right direction with projects I was working on. In the one summer I was there, I felt like I gained four years worth of knowledge. My experience was truly remarkable.
reviews.pros: Free lunch, gym, good working culture

reviews.title: Fast Paced, Goal Orientated & Fun
reviews.text:
TripAdvisor offers diverse opportunities and the chance to work with varied markets. My time there provided me with lot's of investment and development of my skills and a chance to adapt to various cultures. 

The company culture is fast paced, ever changing and evolving requiring and agile and dynamic working approach

reviews.title: Fun place to work
reviews.text: TA has a great employee culture there are excellent perks (free helathcare, kegs, etc.) and frequent fun events. Unfortunately, the laid back environment can foster complacency.
reviews.cons: Limited opportunity for career advancement within the organization, complacency among a number of employees.

reviews.title: Not a great place to work.
reviews.text: One word- disaster. The Latin American sector of this company needs a huge change! Management is absolutely appalling. Can not stress enough how much was given by many and nothing was gained.
reviews.pros: Free Lunches 2 days a week, work from home here and there.

reviews.title: Good Atmosphere
reviews.text: Great experience, good atmosphere at work and great ideas, but sadly the company sometimes hire the staff through an external company

reviews.title: Amazing Internship
reviews.text: There are few if any other companies around the world who will do as much for their employees and interns to make their work life a pleasure. I cannot put into words how great they are.

reviews.title: Great Benefits, Work Culture Declined Over Time
reviews.text: At first, the job was great, and fun with a great work atmosphere. We had perks such as compensated tours and shows on the strip in Las Vegas. Over time, they cracked down on all of that and the morale went way down. Handle times and goals took over everything and the happiness of workers went to the side.
reviews.pros: Great Benefits, a lot of vacation and sick time.

reviews.title: culture is changing
reviews.text:
used to be more positive - toxic in some groups due to new leadership

great company - industry leader

fair culture, benefits are fantastic

recent business strategy doesn't seem to be working

growth has slowed,  less opportunity for  career advancement

reviews.title: Excellent Company
reviews.text: Everyone I worked with was great except for one sales manager that has been there for years, and is very rude to people working under her. I would recommend the company to everyone.

reviews.title: Inernship was good
reviews.text: It was great working with them. It was my first exposure to the professional world and really enjoyed working, the industry guide was very helpful. But I have not received my certificate for an internship correctly.
